summary: This is a PACER docket report for the criminal case USA v. Epstein (1:19-cr-00490-RMB) from the Southern District of New York. It details the procedural history from the sealed indictment and arrest of Jeffrey Epstein in July 2019 through his death in August 2019 and the subsequent dismissal of charges (nolle prosequi). The document lists attorneys, judges, and key procedural events.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case for sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of children. The case was terminated upon his death.

persons.name: Richard M. Berman
persons.context: The U.S. District Judge assigned to the case who presided over hearings, set schedules, and ultimately signed the nolle prosequi order.

persons.name: Henry B. Pitman
persons.context: Presided over the initial appearance, arraignment, and initial detention hearing for Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: Lead defense attorney for Jeffrey Epstein from Steptoe & Johnson, filed motions for pretrial release and other submissions.

persons.name: Martin Gary Weinberg
persons.context: Lead defense attorney for Jeffrey Epstein, present at initial appearances and hearings. Filed a motion to appear pro hac vice.

persons.name: Marc Allan Fernich
persons.context: Lead defense attorney for Jeffrey Epstein, filed corrected and supplemental letters regarding the bail motion.

persons.name: James L. Brochin
persons.context: Lead defense attorney for Jeffrey Epstein from Steptoe & Johnson, present at the bail hearing.

persons.name: Michael Campion Miller
persons.context: Defense attorney for Jeffrey Epstein from Steptoe & Johnson, filed notice of appearance and was present at hearings.

persons.name: Michael Gerard Scavelli
persons.context: Defense attorney for Jeffrey Epstein from Steptoe & Johnson, filed notice of appearance.

persons.name: Gloria Rachel Allred
persons.context: Attorney listed as 'ATTORNEY TO BE NOTICED', later filed a motion regarding victim statements read at the August 27, 2019 hearing.

persons.name: Lamine N'Diaye
persons.context: Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) who corresponded with Judge Berman regarding Epstein's death and the investigation into a prior incident.

persons.name: David Golden
persons.context: Filed a motion to intervene in the case, which was denied by Judge Berman.

persons.name: Bruce A. Green
persons.context: Professor at Fordham University School of Law who wrote to Judge Berman to clarify the record regarding the August 27, 2019 hearing transcript.

persons.name: Thomas Murray
persons.context: Court reporter for several proceedings, including the July 8 and July 18, 2019 conferences.

persons.name: Kelly Surina
persons.context: Court reporter for the July 15, 2019 conference.

persons.name: Kristen Carannante
persons.context: Court reporter for the July 8 and July 31, 2019 conferences.

persons.name: Rose Prater
persons.context: Court reporter for the August 27, 2019 hearing.

persons.name: Lisa Franko
persons.context: Court reporter present at the August 27, 2019 hearing.

persons.name: Colleen McMahon
persons.context: Chief Judge of the Southern District of New York, notified of Epstein's death in a letter.

connections.description: Weingarten was a lead defense attorney representing Epstein in the criminal case, filing motions for pretrial release.
Weinberg was a lead defense attorney present at Epstein's initial appearance, arraignment, and multiple hearings.
Fernich was a lead defense attorney who filed corrected and supplemental submissions for Epstein's bail motion.
Both were lead defense attorneys on Epstein's legal team, appearing together at court conferences.
Judge Berman was the presiding judge over Epstein's criminal case, making rulings on bail and case management.
The MCC Warden and Judge Berman exchanged letters regarding Epstein's death and an investigation into a prior incident at the facility.
Allred was an attorney representing victims in the case, filing motions related to victim statements.

events.title: Case Filed / Sealed Indictment
events.description: Criminal case USA v. Epstein is filed with a sealed indictment against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is arrested while the matter is under seal.

events.title: Initial Appearance and Arraignment
events.description: Initial appearance before Magistrate Judge Pitman. Epstein is present with attorney Martin Weinberg. Arraignment held; Epstein pleads not guilty to counts 1 and 2. Case assigned to Judge Berman.

events.title: Bail Hearing and Denial
events.description: Bail hearing held before Judge Berman. The court denies bail and remands Epstein. A written order follows.

events.title: Incident at MCC
events.description: Mentioned in correspondence as an incident involving Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center that was subject to investigation.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein dies at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at approximately 7:37 a.m.

events.title: Hearing on Nolle Prosequi
events.description: Judge Berman holds a hearing regarding the government's proposed nolle prosequi (dismissal) following Epstein's death. Statements are heard from attorneys and victims.

events.title: Nolle Prosequi Order
events.description: Judge Berman signs the order of nolle prosequi, formally dismissing the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein due to his death.

locations: U.S. District Court Southern District of New York (Foley Square)
Thurgood Marshall United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY
Courtroom 110, 40 Centre Street, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted on July 2, 2019, on charges of sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of children.
Epstein was arrested on July 6, 2019, pleaded not guilty on July 8, and was denied bail and remanded to custody on July 18, 2019.
Epstein died by suicide on August 10, 2019, while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
Following his death, the U.S. Attorney moved for and Judge Berman granted an order of nolle prosequi, dismissing the indictment on August 29, 2019.
The docket shows extensive legal representation for Epstein, including multiple lead attorneys from the firms Steptoe & Johnson and individual practices.
